### forallInterferingAccesses() {#a7e074b029fa7e785f9836fdc15ef50e2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::AAPointerInfo::forallInterferingAccesses (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aa/rangety">AA::RangeTy</a> Range, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; bool(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapointerinfo/access">Access</a> &amp;, bool)&gt; CB) const</>}>
Call <code>CB</code> on all accesses that might interfere with <code>Range</code> and return true if all such accesses were known and the callback returned true for all of them, false otherwise.

An access interferes with an offset-size pair if it might read or write that memory region.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l06187">6187</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### forallInterferingAccesses() {#a1fc4e79b3bc9fd157cd7a6d30ab9d131}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::AAPointerInfo::forallInterferingAccesses (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/abstractattribute">AbstractAttribute</a> &amp; QueryingAA, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp; I, bool FindInterferingWrites, bool FindInterferingReads, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; bool(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapointerinfo/access">Access</a> &amp;, bool)&gt; CB, bool &amp; HasBeenWrittenTo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aa/rangety">AA::RangeTy</a> &amp; Range, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">function&#95;ref</a>&lt; bool(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapointerinfo/access">Access</a> &amp;)&gt; SkipCB=nullptr) const</>}>
Call <code>CB</code> on all accesses that might interfere with <code>I</code> and return true if all such accesses were known and the callback returned true for all of them, false otherwise.

In contrast to forallInterferingAccesses this function will perform reasoning to exclude write accesses that cannot affect the load even if they on the surface look as if they would. The flag <code>HasBeenWrittenTo</code> will be set to true if we know that <code>I</code> does not read the initial value of the underlying memory. If <code>SkipCB</code> is given and returns false for a potentially interfering access, that access is not checked for actual interference.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h/#l06199">6199</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/ipo/attributor-h">Attributor.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
